LayoutNode.Content: My first yelp review/account initiation was due to one of the mostoutstanding services and total quality of product that I have everreceived at a restaurant/bar, but I think I deleted it somehow(Miro's - Palm Springs). I have not done another restaurant reviewsince, because back then I decided to only do positive reviews ofsuperior establishments and not contribute to lackluster reviews.That said, my second restaurant/bar review has taken about sixyears, and it now comes forth due to the consistent experiencesthat I have had at the Folsom Street Foundry (FSF). Sure, FSF seems like a standard bar with its trademark decor andthe staples of the alcohol industry, but the bar is actually anever-evolving establishment, keeping a unique dichotomy of aguaranteed place to get what I want, but also a place that keepspace with San Francisco's dynamic environment. The venueattains this at its foundation in general, but also with varyingevents to which the Foundry decorates uniquely for each. I'vebeen to a country music night of line dancing with a professionalinstructor, the Folsom Street Fair (which seems to be the unofficialwatering hole of the event), Video Game nights, black marketswap meets, evening music jams, beer tastings, and even a prochess tournament! The steady and random events keep this placeas one of my go-to establishments in SOMA, and in SF-proper ingeneral. The front lounge has even had a robot deliver my drinks whenordered from an app! The kitchen has changed its menu forconstant improvement (even though they were all good), and Ilook forward to the most recent change with all of the munchies! Iam stoked that they kept their fresh, made-to-order mini pizzas aswell! To summarize, the Foundry is a place that I've been to enoughtimes that it feels like my local pub with familiar faces, yet eachtime that I am en route, I get excited to see what is new! Cheers!

LayoutNode.Content: 10/1/2018 Strolled in while at Folsom Street Fair. the ONLY bar (out of 4 thatwe went into & out of) we went into that does NOT allow you totake drinks outside. What a joke. Should have had CLEAR SIGNSstating that fact at the Entrance or at the BAR. The Bartenderswere friendly. But the door guy must have been on CRACK.

LayoutNode.Content: This place is really awesome if you like to game! They havegames from super smash to rock band to water "beer" pong andeverything in between. Check it out on Tuesday, Wednesday, andThursday nights! Definitely a fun atmosphere to just game andlaugh.
LayoutNode.SRC: This place is really awesome if you like to game! They have games from super smash to rock band to water "beer" pong and everything in between. Check it out on Tuesday, Wednesday, and Thursday nights! Definitely a fun atmosphere to just game and laugh.

LayoutNode.Content: This is a pretty cool place and well worth the $5 cover, I'd say. Thevenue is pretty big with different sections for different games andtournaments which was pretty organized. I am not much of agamer, but street fighter's definitely a game that's fun to play! Wecame here around 7pm on a Thursday and the place was prettypacked. The beer pong table of course, was pretty popularthroughout the night. I'm not sure how many games there are, but Iknow there's Mario cart, super smash bros, a few versions ofstreet fighter and rock band. Some games however, require you touse your own controller so be sure to bring one if you have onehandy! There are also laptops available for you to play computergames and a few tables to sit and watch the game tournamentsand get a few drinks and food from the bar. The food selection is not huge, so we ended up ordering thechicken tenders and fries for $9 I believe. You order at the bararea and pick up in another section in the back. The chickentenders and fries were alright, just your typical tenders and fries.There is a $10 card minimum though so be sure to bring somecash! There's also some board games available in the front near therock band area. Overall, it's a pretty cool place to chill or hang outwith friends or even on a date ;)

LayoutNode.Content: 7/28/2017 This place is pretty epic. From what I've heard, the eventschanges regularly, but when I went, it was for the SF Game Night(Tues and Thursday, I think) and there was giant projectors ofSuper Smash Brothers, Mario Kart, and Rocket League, along withdozens of smaller TVs of Street Fighter, Tekken....and more SuperSmash Brothers. I especially loved the dedicated Rock Band set-up and tables ofboard games. The vibe was really good, too. Everyone there seemed like goodpeople looking to have a good time. It was pretty easy to findsomeone to sing the chorus of Tenacious D's "Master Exploder"on Rock Band. Haha With food and liquor on hand, too, I could definitely see myselfcoming back and spending hours and hours hanging out.

LayoutNode.Content: Not gonna lie, if I knew there was a $5 cover charge before mygroup arrived, I would've suggested going elsewhere... But I'mglad it didn't work out that way. I'm not a gamer, hell I don't even know the simpler games like beerpong, but this place was fun. All games are free to play - welltechnically that's your cover charge... As for the venue itself, the space is large and there are two bars.Apparently they host a lot of gaming events, but it's open forhappy hour on Tuesdays and Thursdays. They serve food as well. Small menu with burgers, fries andchicken strips being the main things to choose from... Mediocrefood you'd expect but pricy as well. You order at the back bar. Otherwise the staff are friendly and the place is clean - even thebathrooms... And bathrooms with no line to the women's?!?!Thank you gamer boys!
LayoutNode.SRC: Not gonna lie, if I knew there was a $5 cover charge before mygroup arrived, I would've suggested going elsewhere... Small menu with burgers, fries andchicken strips being the main things to choose from... Mediocrefood you'd expect but pricy as well. You order at the back bar.Otherwise the staff are friendly and the place is clean - even thebathrooms... And bathrooms with no line to the women's?!?!Thank you gamer boys!

LayoutNode.Content: My review isn't for the foundry. My review is for an event thathappened at the foundry hosted by SOULMOVERS. It's my cousins 21st Birthday and why not celebrate by buying600$ worth of bottle service. Right when we get to the event weare stopped by two security guards asking what we're here for. Ofcourse we tell them we're here to party and to enjoy our bottleservice. The security then checks our ID's but they seem to forgetto pat us down and check our bags for unsafe items. We then aretold to head to the front desk to show somebody our tickets. Westand there at the desk the worker was just looking at us whileeating her French fries and pickles. Very un professional. We askFrench fry girl where do we go for our bottle service. She then tellsus to go wait by the entrance. After waiting 10 more minutes wedecide to ask another worker where to go. That worker tells us totalk to another worker. Finally, we show her our tickets and theworker explains to us that we bought a package that had onebottle of our choosing and a bottle of champagne. We are thenseated at the most unappealing table near the entrance of theclub. We ask if we could be moved to a different table. Thewaitress tells us the only way we could be moved is to BUYanother bottle. We then explain to the waitress that we don't wantto buy another bottle and we would liked to be moved. Thewaitress then brings out another waiter. The waiter tells us thesame thing. That we can only be moved if we buy another bottle.The waiter then try's to negotiate us by telling us "you guys have 1bottle of your choosing. If you stay here I'll get you a free bottle ofchampagne". This waiter tried to sell us on a bottle we already hadpaid for. I then ask to speak to the owner, and he explains to usthat he is the co owner of the club. So the waiter/co owner thenleaves us and we are then approached by our promoter and hetells us that we can move to a different table. Now that we aremoved to a different table the first waitress then rushes out withour bottle (no sparklers, no sign, nothing! But the tables next to ushad them). It was ridiculous. Moving on we are finally drinking ourdrinks and just trying to make the most of this bad situation. A fewof us leave the table to dance and and Who do we see on thedance floor? We see the waiter/co-owner of the club grinding onevery girl on the dance floor, we then see him passing out drinksto a bunch of random girls (terrible business practice), but Rightwhen we get back we see a security guard sitting our table talkingto one of my cousins. My cousin asked him if she could smokeoutside. The security guard said "you can only smoke if you giveme a dance". That is just plain wrong. Out of no where the chairSNAPS and the security is lying on his back flat. He then gets upthrows the chair to the wall and walks away. We then realize thatit's time for us to leave this terrible event.

We then realize thatit's time for us to leave this terrible event.

LayoutNode.Content: 4/26/2018 This place is definitely dope! I love finding new spots to hang outthat aren't obnoxiously over crowded and this is that spot! It'shuge! We had the pizza and it was bomb. I've been to so manydifferent places in SF and some have been cool while others areno better than a frat house. They have a robotics serving systemand as a tech chick I really thought that was cool. We will for surebe coming back, the servers were super nice and funny. Overall,this is a great spot to go hang out with a chill atmosphere and tonsof space. Will be coming here more often. Cheers!
LayoutNode.SRC:
4/26/2018

This place is definitely dope! I love finding new spots to hang out that aren't obnoxiously over crowded and this is that spot! It's huge! We had the pizza and it was bomb. I've been to so many different places in SF and some have been cool while others are no better than a frat house. They have a robotics serving system and as a tech chick I really thought that was cool. We will for sure be coming back, the servers were super nice and funny. Overall, this is a great spot to go hang out with a chill atmosphere and tons of space. Will be coming here more often. Cheers!

LayoutNode.Content: Been here a few times and always loved it. It's a good place tohang out without spending too much money. The staff is friendlythe venue is large and there are plenty of activities to be enjoyedby everyone. They have board games, video games, beer pongand more! I've never eaten the food so unfortunately I have noadvice for that and we always ordered just whiskey sours, nothingspecial. I'm also not into video games but always enjoyed playingbeer pong. There are two rooms and they both have bars. Thefirst room is more so for people who don't want to play videogames or beer pong, it's not as noisy and is more relaxed. Thesecond room in my opinion is where all the excitement is. I'm surethere's room for improvement, but if you're looking for a placethat's pretty chill, not too rowdy and everyone can enjoy then trythis place out! My friend group is filled with all kinds of people andthis was our go to place for a bit.
LayoutNode.SRC: Been here a few times and always loved it. It's a good place to hang out without spending too much money. The staff is friendly the venue is large and there are plenty of activities to be enjoyed by everyone. They have board games, video games, beer pong and more! I've never eaten the food so unfortunately I have no advice for that and we always ordered just whiskey sours, nothing special. I'm also not into video games but always enjoyed playing beer pong. There are two rooms and they both have bars. The first room is more so for people who don't want to play video games or beer pong, it's not as noisy and is more relaxed. The second room in my opinion is where all the excitement is. I'm sure there's room for improvement, but if you're looking for a place that's pretty chill, not too rowdy and everyone can enjoy then try this place out! My friend group is filled with all kinds of people and this was our go to place for a bit.

LayoutNode.Content: Yesterday was our first night at the foundry. My boyfriend hasbeen hyping this place up for the last year we've been dating. He'sa huge gamer and goes out to the Foundry quite often. I, on theother hand, am down to play games but do not consider myself agamer. Maybe it was our fault for getting there too early but thenight was overall a bit of a letdown. We paid $5 for the covercharge. First of all, there were only two bartenders at the backarea to cater to all of the patrons. One of them was new, too. Theother poor guy had to hold down the fort. Definitely could not keepup with the overflow of people waiting to order drinks. Second, theDJ didn't start playing music until 11:30. So weird. The music theywere playing beforehand was underwhelming. I understand thatthis is a gaming bar, but first and foremost it is a bar. They werehaving a Street Fighter competition last night, and it seemed asthough there weren't enough seats/space for people who were notcompeting. If you love gaming, I would recommend this place, but ifyou're looking for a fun night out, save your $5 and use itsomewhere else. Two stars because of the seasoned bartender. My boyfriendstarted feeling sick and knew how to be efficient it when we'reordered drinks. Also, the one game we wanted to play (Catan) wasmissing dice. Hella sad.

LayoutNode.Content: 2/16/2018 Recently visited the Foundry again and am still really impressed. Ihave come here several times over the years, each time I visit SanFrancisco. The venue is unique, spacious, and versatile. Not reallya gamer, but have been there on Game Nights and it is a fun time,good crowd, enjoy the board games, and always able to get a coldbeer. Great staff. Jordan, owner, continuously works on improvingthe venue. Excited to try their microbrews, from the new newFoundry Brewery, the next time I go.
LayoutNode.SRC:
2/16/2018

Recently visited the Foundry again and am still really impressed. I have come here several times over the years, each time I visit San Francisco. The venue is unique, spacious, and versatile. Not really a gamer, but have been there on Game Nights and it is a fun time, good crowd, enjoy the board games, and always able to get a cold beer. Great staff. Jordan, owner, continuously works on improving the venue. Excited to try their microbrews, from the new new Foundry Brewery, the next time I go.

LayoutNode.Content: Folsom Street Foundry is a dream come true. I wasn't sure what toexpect the first time I came here, but my eyes opened wide in awewhen I saw what this place was about on a Thursday night. Aftergetting your ID checked and paying $5 cover charge, there isRockband, a few card games, and a bar in the first room. Prettychill. Keep walking into the bigger open space and prepareyourself to have the time of your life. This place has one of the coolest vibes in the city, and if you grewup with video games, the Foundry will make you feel at home.Everyone is so friendly and welcoming. All video games arefree-for-all and it's a great way to make new friends. There aretons of different games to play, from Super Smash Brothers andMario Kart to Jenga and Beer Pong. Drinks and food are very reasonably priced. I ordered the burgeroff the menu and tried some of my friend's meatball sandwich,both of which turned out to be delicious. And not like "passable"delicious... like REALLY good. I'm excited to keep coming back toGame Nights on Thursdays (also on Tuesdays) and share thisexperience with all my other video game loving friends!
